intro: Glaucium flavum var. leiocarpum, commonly known as the yellow hound's tongue, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of glaucous, lobed leaves and produces striking yellow flowers with prominent, spurred sepals. The plant is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in rocky or sandy soils. It blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal medicine practices.
